Marie Curie: I would choose to swap places with Marie Curie, a pioneering physicist and chemist who made groundbreaking discoveries in radioactivity. As her, I would have the opportunity to work alongside some of the greatest scientists of my time and make even more significant contributions to the world of science.

Mahatma Gandhi: I would choose to swap places with Mahatma Gandhi, a legendary leader who fought for India's independence from British rule. As him, I would have the opportunity to lead a nation and make a significant impact on world history.

Leonardo da Vinci: I would choose to swap places with Leonardo da Vinci, a polymath who made significant contributions to the fields of art, science, and engineering. As him, I would have the opportunity to work on some of the most famous projects in history and make even more groundbreaking discoveries.

Oprah Winfrey: I would choose to swap places with Oprah Winfrey, a media mogul who has inspired millions of people around the world with her philanthropy, talk show, and book club. As her, I would have the opportunity to use my platform to make a positive impact on the world and inspire others to do the same.

Albert Einstein: I would choose to swap places with Albert Einstein, one of the most famous physicists in history. As him, I would have the opportunity to work on some of the most groundbreaking theories in history and make even more significant contributions to the world of science.
